cab.content: SECRET. From Viceroy, Foreign Department, 20th July 1917. Secret. Mohmands. Blockade maintained since last September hasresulted in submissive peace overtures from Mohmands and very satisfactorysettlement has been now effected on following terms: Forfeiture of theallowances, restoration of captured rifles, responsibility for raids andprotection of blockade line, liability of Mohmands' jaghir in British territoryto forfeit at next settlement, in return for free.access to British territory andrelease of prisoners, restoration of allowances to be considered after the war.Blockade is accordingly being raised.
